goal.ch: This practical class aims at acquiring a better understanding of film coproduction in general and in Taiwan case. The course will consist in case studies, the understanding of different coproduction structures and the coproduction strategies in collaboration with professionals. The course is divided between a first part in class, and a second part that will consist in an internship.
goal.en: This practical class aims at acquiring a better understanding of film coproduction in general and in Taiwan case. The course will consist in case studies, the understanding of different coproduction structures and the coproduction strategies in collaboration with professionals. The course is divided between a first part in class, and a second part that will consist in an internship.

outline.ch:
授課內容：
This course is divided between a first period devoted to the understanding of film coproduction history and strategy, participation to production workshops if some take place during this period, case studies, meeting with professionals.
The goal is to understand :
-the different coproduction structures: festival workshops and subsidies, national film centers (TAICCA in Taiwan, CNC in France…)
-the coproduction process (application methods)
ORGANISATION OF THE SEMESTER
Week 1
Introduction Class
Week 2
Coproduction history and evolution
Week 3
The specific case of Taiwan: coproduction with Asia, Europe, the USA
Week 4
Coproduction : subsidies and film markets : TAICCA
Week 5
Coproduction : subsidies and film markets :Taipei Film Funds (Taipei Film Commission) and regional commissions
Week 6
Coproduction : subsidies and film markets Attending TCCF
Week 7
Coproduction : subsidies and film markets:
Hubert Bals Fonds (Rotterdam Film Festival /Netherland)
Week 8 : subsidies and film markets
Aide aux Cinéma du Monde (CNC/ France) and Ateliers in Cannes (France)
Week 9 The role of the festivals and workshops
Golden Horse Film Festival Workshop
Network of Asian Fantastic Film (Bucheon/ Korea)
Locarno Academy (Switzerland)
Week 10
PAS (Produire au Sud) X TAICCA
Week 11
International Talents (Berlinale)
Udine/ Italy (Ties that bind)
Ateliers in Cannes (France)
Week 12 Internship
Week 13Internship
Week 14 Internship
Week 15 Internship
Week 16 Final presentations
Week 17 Final presentations
In a second period, students will be asked to make an internship (1 month) to get a empirical experience of coproduction.
